entry.title: Israel Intensifies Gaza Bombing, Targets West Bank Militants With Airstrike
entry.content: Aid began to flow into Gaza, but falls far short of what is needed to support the enclave’s more than two million residents, humanitarian agencies warned.

entry.title: Northern Israel Prepares for Possible War With Hezbollah
entry.content: The prospect of a destructive regional war hinges on whether clashes with Hezbollah on the border with Lebanon can be contained.

entry.title: Americans Back Israel but Are Wary of Getting Pulled Into Conflict
entry.content: A WSJ-Ipsos poll finds more people in the U.S. sympathize with Israelis than with the Palestinian people, although younger Americans are more divided.

entry.title: Companies Clash Over Billions of Dollars in Hydrogen Tax Breaks
entry.content: Big energy producers and environmental groups are trying to influence the rules governing a new clean-energy industry.

entry.title: Taking Gaza Would Be Possible, Sieges From Recent Conflicts Show---but at a Terrible Cost
entry.content: Israel’s planned land campaign against Hamas promises to be destructive and bloody as urban warfare favors defenders.

entry.title: Ukraine's Slow Advance Challenges Kyiv, Allies
entry.content: The country’s counteroffensive hasn’t achieved a breakthrough, and global attention is shifting to the conflict in the Middle East.
